content: Il blocco sul numero massimo di account non viene da Thunderbird (che non ha limiti) ma da Google. Devi chiedere a loro. In passato Gmail poteva essere configurata come una normale caselle di posta elettronica. Ora Google ha imposto che il login debba passare dal loro sito web (come si vede nel tuo screenshot) per cui possono applicare questo genere di blocco.
creator: @next

content: Ok, ho capito, grazie.. e non c'è un modo per non passare tramite google? Magari qualche impostazione da modificare su thunderbird

content: You can leave the name as is, or rename it from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles. Might be helpful if you have several profiles or multiple versions of TB installed.

content:
Are they visible when you log into webmail? If so, see if those folders are subscribed:

- on the main mail screen in the L. column, R. click the account (just above the Inbox) > Subscribe
creator: siffemoz

content:
Yes, but they come from three different email accounts and of course only the recent ones, some of the emails stored in TB on my hard drive go back years (decades?) and are long gone from any webmail account. So it's really a local issue. I went into the mail folder on my hard drive (Users/Username/Library/Thunderbird/Profiles/xyz.default-release/Mail) and the missing folder was there alright, but I didn't have permissions ("no entry" sign). Very peculiar. I checked the permissions and it said I had read/write (even stranger), so I changed it to read only then back to read/write and it still showed the no entry symbol. So I gave read/write permissions to everyone and that solved the permissions problem. I checked the folder again, and the email file had disappeared. The msf file was there, but not the email.

I have no idea how that happened but I got a backup from Time Machine and put it back. All well now. But a mystery nonetheless.
creator: mwanamizi

content: No one can offer suggestions unless you provide details on the problem or error messages. please also include URL from which you downloaded thunderbird. thank you
creator: davidsk

content: The feature to reorganize folders in alphabetic order is in the monthly release (146). rightclick on account in folder pane and the reset order option is there. Otherwise, there is an addon - https://services.addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/manually-sort-folders/ but I have not tried it, nor do I know if it is supported in current releases.
creator: davidsk

content: In this section of the forum we speak Italian. For english support -> https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/thunderbird/form

content:
Do you see an error that TB 'is already in use' and you must 'close the existing process'?

Try removing the profile lock:

https://kb.mozillazine.org/Profile_in_use#Remove_the_profile_lock_file

content:
i presume so. not very tech savvy. ai seemed to be sending me down a rabbit hole when asked to complete this task: "forward my gmail acct into a TB acct." in fact this particular gmail acct had been forwarded into a TB acct successfully for 5 or 6 years, but when recently migrating a website (that uses the email in question to correspond with clients/shoppers), the email system broke when going from hostinger to godaddy.

With AI we were able to set up a new gmail acct transfer from hostinger to google, so i can see my emails thru gmail. but would prefer they forward to TB. When going thru instructions to complete the forwarding, the AI clearly misunderstood or did not know how to do as numerous steps failed, after which AI declared: "oh that explains everything," then gave new instructions, and again it failed, etc., eventually leading to this popup window appear repeatedly whenever my TB acct is open (open to be for another email [not the one in question], which i use more regularly for other personal and professional issues.
creator: bkrakow
